title: Correcting term label. Fixes #30051
author: sjm41

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
<!-- GITHUB_ACTION_COMMENT_PR -->
Here's a diff of how these changes impact the classified ontology: 

# Ontology comparison

## Left
- Ontology IRI: `http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/go.owl`
- Version IRI: `http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/go/releases/2025-06-06/go.owl`
- Loaded from: `file:/__w/go-ontology/go-ontology/src/ontology/../../reasoned-master.owl/reasoned.owl`

## Right
- Ontology IRI: `http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/go.owl`
- Version IRI: `http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/go/releases/2025-06-06/go.owl`
- Loaded from: `file:/__w/go-ontology/go-ontology/src/ontology/../../reasoned-pr.owl/reasoned.owl`

### Ontology imports 



### Ontology annotations 



### positive regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate `http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GO_0140176`
#### Removed
- [positive regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate](http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GO_0140176) [label](http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#label) "positive regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate" 

#### Added
- [positive regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate](http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GO_0140176) [label](http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#label) "positive regulation of pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA"

diff:
diff --git a/src/ontology/go-edit.obo b/src/ontology/go-edit.obo
index 0d82a4413..25baeffdb 100644
--- a/src/ontology/go-edit.obo
+++ b/src/ontology/go-edit.obo
@@ -453822,7 +453822,7 @@ creation_date: 2025-05-20T08:52:20Z
 
 [Term]
 id: GO:0140176
-name: positive regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate
+name: positive regulation of pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA
 namespace: biological_process
 def: "Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of acetyl-CoA from pyruvate. In most organisms, this pathway links glycolysis to the TCA cycle, by a series of three reactions carried out by a multisubunit complex called the 'pyruvate dehydrogenase complex', even though pyruvate dehydrogenase activity describes only one of those reactions." [PMID:15855260]
 intersection_of: GO:0065007 ! biological regulation

linked_issues.title: NTR: positive regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate
linked_issues.body:
Please provide as much information as you can: 

* **Suggested term label:**
positive regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate

* **Definition (free text)**
Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of acetyl-CoA from pyruvate. In most organisms, this pathway links glycolysis to the TCA cycle, by a series of three reactions carried out by a multisubunit complex called the 'pyruvate dehydrogenase complex', even though pyruvate dehydrogenase activity describes only one of those reactions.

* **Reference, in format PMID:#######**
PMID:15855260

* **Gene product name and ID to be annotated to this term**
human PDP1 (Q9P0J1)

* **Parent term(s)**
GO:0010510 regulation of pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA
linked_issues.author: rozaru

comments.author: ValWood
comments.body:
We captured this as part_of with direct positive regulation/activation
https://www.pombase.org/gocam/gene/67086be200000251/SPAC10F6.17c/ptc5

Is this not the correct way to do this?
I'm constantly confused by this so it would be useful if we can get an answer when we meet in Geneva.

comments.author: ValWood
comments.body: My understanding is that pathway regulation is part of the regulation of activity. So this one depends on the pathway start, I guess.

comments.author: pgaudet
comments.body:
If I am not mistaken, the pombe orthologs is [pkp1 Spom](https://www.pombase.org/gene/SPAC644.11c)

Which you have annotated to a regulation BP:
> [pyruvate dehydrogenase (acetyl-transferring) kinase activity](http://amigo.geneontology.org/amigo/term/GO:0004740)
part of
[regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate](http://amigo.geneontology.org/amigo/term/GO:0010510)
occurs in
[mitochondrion](http://amigo.geneontology.org/amigo/term/GO:0005739)

So, the positive regulation seems more appropriate?

comments.author: ValWood
comments.body:
The pdp1 ortholog is ptc5
pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA
mitochondrial pyruvate dehydrogenase (lipoamide) phosphatase

which we have annotated to part_of

Pkp1 is the phosphate we have annotated to "regulation" so yes this is inconsistent.

This one of the questions I wanted to ask, should these be annotated to regulation  if they are considered part of the pathway?

These 2 regulators are both 'downstream' of pyruvate, so they must be part_of the pathway.

How does this differ from any other enzyme activator or inhibitor? We don't annotate these to +/- regulation of process?

comments.author: ValWood
comments.body:
For example here:
https://www.pombase.org/gocam/gene/6690711d00002706/SPBC14C8.04/ilv6
is an activator of Ilv1 but I annotated as part_of  the amino acid biosynthesis pathways rather than 
"regulation of"
https://www.pombase.org/gene/SPBC14C8.04

comments.author: rozaru
comments.body:
> Is this not the correct way to do this?
> I'm constantly confused by this so it would be useful if we can get an answer when we meet in Geneva.

When I started to make GO_CAM I asked about the difference between the regulatory terms for single annotation and the regulation relationship used in GO CAM. Someone (unfortunately I donâ€™t remember who) said that they are 2 different type of annotations and I should carry on using regulatory terms for single annotation. Is this not true anymore?

I agree with Val it would be good to know

- where to draw the line between part of a pathway and regulates a pathway for enzymes that directly affects the activity of the main participants of a pathway 
- when to use enzyme regulator activity and regulation of activity

For the pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA pathway:

- pyruvate dehydrogenase kinase (PDK) phosphorylates and inhibits the E1 subunit of pyruvate dehydrogenase complex 
Which annotation is appropriate:
negative regulation of pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA pathway
enzyme inhibitor activity

- pyruvate dehydrogenase phosphatase (PDK) dephosphorylates and activates the E1 subunit of pyruvate dehydrogenase complex 
Which annotation is appropriate:
positive regulation of pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA pathway
enzyme activator activity
In fly this protein is involved in other pathways

comments.author: ValWood
comments.body: @pgaudet  can we put this high on the agenda for the GO-CAM meeting day. The guidelines here are very unclear.

comments.author: pgaudet
comments.body: Added, thanks for the suggestion.

comments.author: edwong57
comments.body: @pgaudet @ValWood Was this resolved at the GO meeting? Could you point me to the discussion/minutes?

comments.author: ValWood
comments.body:
We didn't get through the presentations so there were no discussion on specific problems.

@vanaukenk  can this be discussed  on a future GO-CAM call?

comments.author: vanaukenk
comments.body:
@ValWood @rozaru - yes, we can definitely put this on a GO-CAM call agenda.
This coming Thursday, the 22nd, Paul D. is scheduled to speak, but we could have another call next week, if people want.

comments.author: ValWood
comments.body:
I already have an immovable meeting next week 
3:00â€¯PMâ€“7:30â€¯PM BST which is over the GO-CaM slot so maybe the week after?

comments.author: vanaukenk
comments.body: @ValWood  - sure we could plan for Thursday, June 5th.  Please confirm.  Thanks!

comments.author: edwong57
comments.body: @vanaukenk, June 5 works for me.

comments.author: ValWood
comments.body: I won't be able to confirm this date until the week starting June 6th. I'm officially on holiday for a couple weeks in June, but that week is the Elixir all-hands meeting, and I have committed to a workshop; I don't have the details yet. I will be working some days but not sure which ones.

comments.author: edwong57
comments.body: @ValWood have you figured a date that works for you to discuss this at a GO-CAM call?

comments.author: pgaudet
comments.body:
+[Term]
+id: GO:0140176
+name: positive regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate
+namespace: biological_process
+def: "Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of acetyl-CoA from pyruvate. In most organisms, this pathway links glycolysis to the TCA cycle, by a series of three reactions carried out by a multisubunit complex called the 'pyruvate dehydrogenase complex', even though pyruvate dehydrogenase activity describes only one of those reactions." [PMID:15855260]
+intersection_of: GO:0065007 ! biological regulation
+intersection_of: positively_regulates GO:0006086 ! pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA
+property_value: term_tracker_item "https://github.com/geneontology/go-ontology/issues/30051" xsd:anyURI
+created_by: pg
+creation_date: 2025-06-04T08:32:15Z

comments.author: rozaru
comments.body:
I am sorry I made a mistake in the name for the new GO term GO:0140176 positive regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate

The name should have been **positive regulation of pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA**. Would it be possible to correct it? @pgaudet @sjm41

comments.author: ValWood
comments.body:
I'm still not convinced this should not be part_of

I have used "regulation in my model, because that was the existing IBA annotation.

I still think it should probably be part of the BP with  directly positively regulated.
We were going to discuss...

comments.author: ValWood
comments.body: If regulation is the correct way to annotate, we would also need a negative regulation for the antagonising phosphatase ptc5(PDP1). Regulator / Factor | Effect on Pkp1 / PDC activity -- | -- Glucose availability | â†‘ Glucose â†’ â†‘ Pkp1 activity â†’ â†“ PDC activity Respiratory growth | â†“ Pkp1, â†‘ Pdp1 â†’ â†‘ PDC activity Pdp1 phosphatase | Antagonizes Pkp1 by dephosphorylating PDC There does not appear to be any post-transcriptional upstream regulation of pkp1/pdp1; regulation seems to be transcriptional.

comments.author: rozaru
comments.body:
The current branch is like this:
GO:0006086 pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA
|_ GO:0010510 regulation of pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA
| __| _ GO:0160218 negative regulation of pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA	**use for pkp1**
| __| _ GO:0140176 positive regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate **use for ptc5**

@ValWood  Happy to discuss it in the next GO-CAM.

comments.author: sjm41
comments.body:
> I am sorry I made a mistake in the name for the new GO term GO:0140176 positive regulation of acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process from pyruvate
The name should have been positive regulation of pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA. Would it be possible to correct it? @pgaudet @sjm41

I'll correct the name now

comments.author: ValWood
comments.body:
I'll use the regulation terms  for both and add to  my list of questions  about regulation with other examples
.

[38;2;222;222;222mname: positive regulation of pyruvate decarboxylation to acetyl-CoA[0m

[38;2;222;222;222mnamespace: biological_process[0m

[38;2;222;222;222mdef: "Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of acetyl-CoA from pyruvate. In most organisms, this pathway links glycolysis to the TCA cycle, by a series of three reactions carried out by a multisubunit complex called the 'pyruvate dehydrogenase complex', even though pyruvate dehydrogenase activity describes only one of those reactions."
